data.title: War Against Crypto Not Dead As Digital Asset Developers Still Being Prosecuted: Lawyer John Deaton
data.description:
Digital asset lawyer and advocate John Deaton says the “war against crypto” isn’t dead despite the recent shift in US presidential administrations. Deaton says on the social media platform X that there are still important cases going on even though Gary Gensler isn’t running the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) anymore. The lawyer notes […]
The post War Against Crypto Not Dead As...
source: https://dailyhodl.com/2025/02/04/war-against-crypto-not-dead-as-digital-asset-developers-still-being-prosecuted-lawyer-john-deaton/

data.title: Goldfinch launches Prime Funding Pool to provide users with on-chain private credit investment opportunities
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News Goldfinch, a DeFi protocol backed by a16z Crypto and Coinbase Ventures, has launched a new fund pool called "Prime" to provide users with on-chain investment opportunities in private credit fund giants.
Goldfinch Prime will provide non-US investors with investment opportunities in thousands of loans from private credit companies including Apollo Global Management, Ares Management and Golub Capital, which together manage more than $1 trillion in assets.
The Goldfinch Prime fund pool adopts a continuous open model, allowing users to invest at any time. After investors deposit USDC stablecoins, they will receive GPRIME fund pool tokens, which represent their proportional share in the fund pool. The target net return rate of the fund pool is 9% to 12%. (The Block)

data.title: FTX Repayments Will Start In Next 2 Weeks After Long Wait
data.description:

data.title: Tether Treasury Mints 1 Billion USDT on Tron Network
data.description: According to Odaily, Whale Alert monitoring data indicates that at approximately 1:06 AM UTC+8, Tether Treasury minted an additional 1 billion USDT on the Tron network.

data.title: Ionic suffered a loss of $8.6 million in an attack, and its predecessor Midas protocol was attacked twice
data.description:
Odaily Planet Daily News On-chain data shows that Ionic on Mode suffered a loss of $8.6 million from an attack.
On-chain detective ZachXBT said on this matter: Ionic's predecessor was the Midas protocol. Midas suffered two hacker attacks in 2023, but the Ionic project used the old audit report of Midas in 2022 when it went online.
In this regard, ZachXBT once sent a private message to the team to question the security of Ionic's contracts. The team said that their code base was based on the Compound fork, and the vulnerability in Midas was due to a known vulnerability in the Compound code. These problems have been fixed by implementing whitelists and reentry attack circuit breakers in the new pool, emphasizing that Ionic is very safe.
Odaily previously reported that the Ionic platform based on Mode was hacked, and hackers used unofficial fake LBTC (Lombard BTC) as collateral for lending on the Ionic platform. The team is investigating, and Odaily reminds users not to interact with it.

data.title: Tether mints 1 billion more USDT on Tron network
data.description: Whale Alert monitoring data showed that at around 1:06 am Beijing time, Tether Treasury minted an additional 1,000,000,000 USDT on the Tron network.
